summary: "The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari" is a classic German silent horror film from 1920. Directed by Robert Wiene, it tells the story of a hypnotist, Dr. Caligari, who controls a sleepwalker to commit murders. The film is known for its unique, twisted visual style and is considered a key part of German Expressionism. It explores themes of authority, sanity, and human nature. Though its initial reception was mixed, it's now praised as revolutionary and has influenced many modern horror and noir films.
title: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
